p: In this study, we report cytotoxic and antimicrobial activities of essential oils from the leaves of B. salicifolius. This essential oil is a promising cytotoxic agent by its action and selectivity demonstrated here, and is a diverse source of molecules that may have an important role in drug discovery for the treatment of estrogen-receptor negative tumors, which has been a challenge in oncology. Moreover, the antifungal action of this essential oil against Paracoccidioides brasiliensis, the causative agent of paracoccidioidomycosis, shows potential to be used in the treatment of this mycosis. Thus, relevant biological activities and high yield of the essential oil from B. salicifolius means it is a source of molecules to be exploited for medicine and by the pharmaceutical industry.
